lines:
Mamma

1956

Emperial Medical College,

Pient in October 2nd 1909.

ras

Alfred. E. Stearns Esqr.

Phillips Acadences 
Dear Sie

I was very glad to have received 
your very Kuid letter of some deconths ago 
acknowledgeng the receipt of the five hundred 
dollars for the account of my son t. S. Kwan.

d'am quite confident that the advantages 
of an American education under your good 
quedance will benefit the Chinese al lange, 
and the memory war Kaidee

shall 
never be erased 
that derived their enlightments for such a 
Christian like Principal as yourse 
Enclosed please find á che

e hundred 
dollars for the account of

buesa

seg heart

check

son.

Believe me

Your Mery sincerely,

K. S. Kwan
raw: Mamma  1956  Emperial Medical College,  Pient in October 2nd 1909.  ras  Alfred. E. Stearns Esqr.  Phillips Acadences  Dear Sie  I was very glad to have received  your very Kuid letter of some deconths ago  acknowledgeng the receipt of the five hundred  dollars for the account of my son t. S. Kwan.  d'am quite confident that the advantages  of an American education under your good  quedance will benefit the Chinese al lange,  and the memory war Kaidee  shall  never be erased  that derived their enlightments for such a  Christian like Principal as yourse  Enclosed please find á che  e hundred  dollars for the account of  buesa  seg heart  check  son.  Believe me  Your Mery sincerely,  K. S. Kwan

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter thanking Stearns for the acknowledgment of the $500 payment sent for his son. Kwan is confident that an American education will be valuable for China at large. The students are grateful for Stearns' energy and Christian-like demeanor.
